intro: Chavica leptostachya, commonly known as the slender-stemmed chavica, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are ovate and slightly hairy, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Chavica leptostachya is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
